intro: Linociera elliptica, commonly known as the elliptical spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Linociera elliptica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
